symbols.name: sap.ca.ui
symbols.description: SAP UI library: Fiori Commons

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.AddPicture
nodes.description: Enables users to add pictures into a form. Contains PictureItem controls that describe the media. It is designed to be used simultaneously with the PictureViewer control

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext
nodes.description:
This control allows you to open a dialog containing a list of customers for users to pick. The chosen selected customer is persisted using sap.ushell services that shall be fully configured outside of this control.

The dialog can be open following two modes: "select" : exiting without choosing a customer is firing the customerSelected event with a null customer before closing the dialog "change" : exiting without choosing a customer is simply closing the dialog

When opening the dialog in "select" mode, if a customer has been persisted in a previous session, it will be retrieved and the dialog won't open at all.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.CustomerControlListItem
nodes.description: Extends the ObjectListItem to display a line in the customer context control.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.DatePicker
nodes.description: Allows end users to interact with dates. Entries can directly be written in, or selected from a calendar pad.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.ExpansibleFeedListItem
nodes.description: Extends the FeedListItem to hide text when it is longer than maxLines. When text is hidden a See more link is displayed, clicking on the link displays the entire text.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.FileUpload
nodes.description: Allows you to display a list of uploaded files. You can also upload a new one, rename or delete them

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.GrowingTileContainer
nodes.description: A Tile container for the Overview tile with growing capabilities

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog
nodes.description: Select an item in a dialog from a hierarchical list

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialogItem
nodes.description: Kind of item required by the sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog control. An item is actually one page of the Dialog.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.Hierarchy
nodes.description: Display the Hierarchy of an item. Useful to indicates where an object stand in a chain of hierarchical data. The emphasized item shows the one item to display. Optional item can be hidden using the hideOptionalLevels property. Hidden items will stay accessible with an expand button.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.HierarchyItem
nodes.description: Item that represent a line of the Hierarchy control. The emphasized property should apply to the item that we want to represent in his hierarchy. Optionals item will be hidden if the option is true on the Hierarchy control.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.InPlaceEdit
nodes.description: This control is used to switch between readonly and edit modes. A typical use case would be to change the value of a Label.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.message
nodes.description:
Provides methods to show messages with type of Success, Error, Warning and Information in a Fiori style.

sap.ca.ui.message is a static class, the statement jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.message.message") needs to be called before the function can be used. Example: 

   jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.message.message");
   
   // provide your callback function, if you want to get informed after the user closes the MessageBox
   var bIsMsgBoxClosed = false;
   var fnClose = function(){
       bIsMsgBoxClosed = true;
   };
   
   // show the erorr message in a MessageBox
   sap.ca.ui.message.showMessageBox({
       type: sap.ca.ui.message.Type.ERROR,
       message: "No connection can be established to the backend system ABC",
       details: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, eum an vidit ..."
   }, fnClose);

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.Notes
nodes.description: This control is a List with the ability to render an additional control on top of it to add new notes. The developer is responsible to give the correct template to use to display notes (recommended are either the FeedListItem or the ExpansibleFeedListItem). The developer is also responsible to implement the code to send the notes to the backend system, by responding to the addNote event.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.OverflowContainer
nodes.description: The OverflowContainer allows the content of a control to be partially displayed before being fully expanded. It will cut its content to a fixed height that can be defined. It is fully suitable within an IconTabBar.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile
nodes.description: Display aTile that presents an overview of a customer

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.PictureItem
nodes.description: A picture / photo Item for AddPicture and PictureViewer Controls

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new AddPicture.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • buttonPageType : string (default: 'Tab')
    • editable : boolean (default: true)
    • maxPictureNumber : int (default: 10)
    • uploadUrl : string
    • width : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '100%')
    • text : string
    • pictureAlign : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Left)
    • itemSize : int (default: 64)
    • compression : string (default: 'low')
  • Aggregations
    • pictures : sap.ca.ui.PictureItem[]
  • Associations
    • Events
      • show : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • pictureAdded : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • maxPictureLimitReached : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • imageUploadFailed : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • fileNotSupported : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

    • xAxisFixedRange : boolean (default: false)

symbols.title: class sap.ca.ui.charts.BubbleChart
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.24
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.24. Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart
symbols.description: Chart implementation on top of sap.viz that takes care of common functionality. - Embedding in a scroll container - Common color palette - Minimum bar / dot / blip ... size - Integration with ChartToolbar and ChartPopover

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new charts/Chart.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • width : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '100%')
    • height : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '100%')
    • dataset : object
    • chartType : string (default: 'Bar')
    • minShapeSize : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '48px')
    • label : string (default: '')
    • title : string (default: '')
    • icon : string (default: '')
    • secondAxisVisible : boolean (default: true)
    • showLegend : boolean (default: true)
    • selectionMode : sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartSelectionMode (default: sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartSelectionMode.Multiple)
    • showHoverBackground : boolean (default: false)
    • showTooltip : boolean (default: false)
    • showPopover : boolean (default: true)
    • showDataLabel : boolean (default: true)
    • yAxisLabelFormatter : string
    • yAxis2LabelFormatter : string
    • xAxisLabelFormatter : string
    • xAxis2LabelFormatter : string
    • plotAreaAxisTooltipFormatter : object
    • tooltipFormatter : object
    • dataLabelFormatter : object
    • popoverFormatter : object
    • popoverGroupFormatter : string
    • chartSemanticColorFormatter : object
    • internalVizChart : sap.ui.core.Control
    • chartPopOver : sap.ui.core.Control
    • popoverSubHeader : sap.ui.core.Control
    • popoverFooter : sap.ui.core.Control
    • advancedChartSettings : object
    • stackedChartWidthEnhancer : boolean (default: false)
    • noData : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        • selectDataPoint : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
        • popoverBeforeOpen : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
        • popoverAfterOpen : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

symbols.title: class sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.24
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.24. Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

aggregations.name: charts
aggregations.description:
The charts to display. Theses charts are sap.ui.core/Control that implements the following properties: - showLegend: boolean - icon: string (expected a string such as "sap-icon://line-chart")

If the inserted control is an sap.m.Table, the icon is automatically set to "sap-icon://table-chart"

aggregations.name: toolBar
aggregations.description: The composite sap.m.Bar used for rendering select boxes and icons.

associations.name: firstDimensionSelect
associations.description: The sap.m.Select inserted into the toolBar for handling the firstDimension selection

associations.name: secondDimensionSelect
associations.description: The sap.m.Select inserted into the toolBar for handling the secondDimension selection

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new charts/ChartToolBar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • showPersonalization : boolean (default: false)
    • showFullScreen : boolean (default: false)
    • fullScreen : boolean (default: false)
    • showLegend : boolean (default: true)
    • chartTitle : string (default: '')
    • firstDimensionPath : string (default: '')
    • firstDimensionKeyPath : string (default: '')
    • firstDimensionTextPath : string (default: '')
    • secondDimensionPath : string (default: '')
    • secondDimensionKeyPath : string (default: '')
    • secondDimensionTextPath : string (default: '')
  • Aggregations
    • charts : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • toolBar : sap.m.Bar
  • Associations
    • selectedChart : string | sap.ui.core.Control
    • firstDimensionSelect : string | sap.m.Select
    • secondDimensionSelect : string | sap.m.Select
  • Events
    • personalizationPressed : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • firstDimensionKeySelected : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • secondDimensionKeySelected : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

events.description: Event fired when a user selects an item from the second select box. This event is providing the item selectedKey as parameter

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. The supported settings are:

  • Properties

    • items : object
  • Aggregations

      • Events

        In addition, all settings applicable to the base type sap.m.ListItemBase can be used as well.

The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new charts/StackedHorizontalBarChart.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • type : string (default: 'StackedBar')
    • minTouchSize : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '48px')
    • dataLabelFormat : any (default: [["##"]])
  • Aggregations
    • content : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • Events

      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart can be used as well.

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext
symbols.description:
This control allows you to open a dialog containing a list of customers for users to pick. The chosen selected customer is persisted using sap.ushell services that shall be fully configured outside of this control.

The dialog can be open following two modes: "select" : exiting without choosing a customer is firing the customerSelected event with a null customer before closing the dialog "change" : exiting without choosing a customer is simply closing the dialog

When opening the dialog in "select" mode, if a customer has been persisted in a previous session, it will be retrieved and the dialog won't open at all.

properties.description: Property name of the customer ID

To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • personalizationPageName : string (default: 'AppCustomerContext')
    • showSalesArea : boolean (default: false)

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.dialog.confirmation
symbols.description:
Provides methods to show a confirmation dialog in the Fiori style.

sap.ca.ui.dialog.confirmation is a static class, the statement jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.dialog.factory") needs to be called before the function can be used. Example: 

   jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.dialog.factory");
   
   // provide your callback function, so that you can get informed if the enduser confirms or cancels the dialog
   var fnClose = function(oResult) {
       if (oResult) {
           console.log("isConfirmed:" + oResult.isConfirmed);
           if (oResult.sNote) {
               console.log(oResult.sNote);
           }
       }
   }
   
   //open the confirmation dialog
   sap.ca.ui.dialog.confirmation.open({
       question : "Send your decision on the shopping card submitted by Henry Emerald?",
       showNote : true,
       title : "Send",
       confirmButtonLabel : "Send"
   }, fnClose);

methods.name: open

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description:
settings for the confirmation dialog

The supported settings are:

additionalInformation : {array} optional, up-to 4 lines can be shown, every line has the structure: {label: "Leave Type", text: "Vacation"}

confirmButtonLabel {string} text for the confirm button

noteMandatory :{boolean} optional, default false

question : {string} the question/action which the user needs to confirm

showNote : {boolean} default true

title : {string} title of the dialog

parameters.name: fnClose
parameters.description:
the function will be called if the confirmation dialog is closed.

there are 2 default values can be retrieved:

isConfirmed : {boolean} true if the user confirms the action; false if the user cancels the dialog

sNote : {string} the note text provided by the user

methods.description: Opens the confirmation dialog

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • maxLines : int (default: 5)
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events

        In addition, all settings applicable to the base type sap.m.FeedListItem can be used as well.

symbols.description: Allows you to display a list of uploaded files. You can also upload a new one, rename or delete them

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FileUpload.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • uploadUrl : string
    • fileName : string
    • size : string
    • url : string
    • uploadedDate : string
    • contributor : string
    • fileExtension : string
    • mimeType : string
    • items : string
    • uploadEnabled : boolean
    • fileId : string
    • xsrfToken : string
    • useMultipart : boolean (default: false)
    • acceptRequestHeader : string (default: 'application/json')
    • encodeUrl : string
    • renameEnabled : boolean
    • deleteEnabled : boolean
    • multipleSelectionEnabled : boolean (default: true)
    • showNoData : boolean (default: false)
    • sequentialUploadsEnabled : boolean (default: false)
    • showAttachmentsLabel : boolean (default: true)
    • useEditControls : boolean (default: false)
    • showAttachmentsLabelInEditMode : boolean (default: true)
    • editMode : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • uploadProgressLabel : sap.m.Label
    • attachmentNumberLabel : sap.m.Label
    • toolBar : sap.m.Toolbar
  • Associations
    • Events
      • deleteFile : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • renameFile : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • uploadFile : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • fileUploadFailed : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • beforeUploadFile : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • saveClicked : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • cancelClicked : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

events.name: beforeUploadFile
events.description: Fired just before the control is about to make a file upload request. The data passed is the file object selected by the user. You may handle this event to attach custom headers for example if your service implementation requires it.

events.name: cancelClicked
events.description: Fired when the cancel button is clicked. The consumer may handle the event if required.

deprecated.text: This method is deprecated now

events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.21.1. This method is deprecated now

events.name: deleteFile
events.description: Fired when a file deletion event occurs typically by clicking a the delete icon. The file descriptor json for the file to be deleted is passed in the event data

events.name: fileUploadFailed
events.description: Fired when a file fails to upload. The error code and response data is passed in this event. The consumer should handle the error by showing the appropriate message.

events.name: renameFile
events.description: Fired when a file is renamed. The file descripter json for the file to be renamed is passed in the event data and also a property, newFilename, that contains the new filename.

events.name: saveClicked
events.description: Fired when the save button is clicked. The consumer should handle the event and save all the file renames to backend.

deprecated.text: This method is deprecated now. The rename or delete event is enough and should be use to commit the action immediatly

events.name: uploadFile
events.description: Fired when a file is uploaded and the response comes back from service. The service response for the file to be added to the list is passed in the event data and the consumer must format it in the correct json structure and pass it back to the control using commitUploadFile method.

methods.name: getTooltip
methods.description:
Returns the tooltip for this InPlaceEdit if any or an undefined value. The tooltip can either be a simple string or a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase.

Callers that are only interested in tooltips of type string (e.g. to render them as a title attribute), should call the convenience method #getTooltip_AsString instead. If they want to get a tooltip text no matter where it comes from (be it a string tooltip or the text from a TooltipBase instance) then they could call #getTooltip_Text instead.

If a content control is assigned to the InPlaceEdit the tooltip of this control is used. A directly set tooltip to the InPlaceEdit is ignored in this case.

If a new tooltip is set, any previously set tooltip is deactivated.

If a content control is assigned to the InPlaceEdit the tooltip of this control is used. A directly set tooltip to the InPlaceEdit is ignored in this case.

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.message
symbols.description:
Provides methods to show messages with type of Success, Error, Warning and Information in a Fiori style.

sap.ca.ui.message is a static class, the statement jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.message.message") needs to be called before the function can be used. Example: 

   jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.message.message");
   
   // provide your callback function, if you want to get informed after the user closes the MessageBox
   var bIsMsgBoxClosed = false;
   var fnClose = function(){
       bIsMsgBoxClosed = true;
   };
   
   // show the erorr message in a MessageBox
   sap.ca.ui.message.showMessageBox({
       type: sap.ca.ui.message.Type.ERROR,
       message: "No connection can be established to the backend system ABC",
       details: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, eum an vidit ..."
   }, fnClose);

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description:
settings for the message box

The supported settings are:

type : {sap.ca.ui.message.Type}

message : {string} short text, the leading and ending white spaces will be removed

details : {string} long text (optional), the detailed information will only be shown if the text is available and different to the message text

parameters.name: fnClose
parameters.description: the function will be called if the message box is closed

methods.description: Shows the messages with type of Success, Error, Warning, Info, in a Fiori style of MessageBox

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.model.format.DateFormat
symbols.description:
The DateFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing date and time values according to a set of format options.

It uses sap.ui.core.format.DateFormat to format and parse dates, and adds a new style daysAgo for Date instances. With this style:

  • For today: "Today" will be displayed (localized)
  • For yesterday: "1 day ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • Between 2 days and 6 days in the past: "x days ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • In the future or more than 6 days in the past: the date will be formatted with a medium style
The daysAgo style can be formatted in UTC.

Supported format options are pattern based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.

Documentation links:

  • http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Date_Field_Symbol_Table

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.Notes
symbols.description: This control is a List with the ability to render an additional control on top of it to add new notes. The developer is responsible to give the correct template to use to display notes (recommended are either the FeedListItem or the ExpansibleFeedListItem). The developer is also responsible to implement the code to send the notes to the backend system, by responding to the addNote event.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Placeholder text shown when no value available . Default value is "Add note".

properties.name: showNoteInput
properties.description: If set to true, this control will render an additional control to create new notes.

properties.name: textMaxLength
properties.description: max text input length

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Notes.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • showNoteInput : boolean (default: true)
    • textMaxLength : int (default: 1000)
    • placeholder : string
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        • addNote : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type sap.m.List can be used as well.

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.OverflowContainer
symbols.description: The OverflowContainer allows the content of a control to be partially displayed before being fully expanded. It will cut its content to a fixed height that can be defined. It is fully suitable within an IconTabBar.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: This property allows to fully expand the container

properties.name: overflowHeight
properties.description: The height of the container when not expanded. It should be determined by the application. The default value is set to 200px.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Controls to be embedded.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new OverflowContainer.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • overflowHeight : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '200px')
    • expanded : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • content : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • Events

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: the content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some content oContent to the aggregation named content.

methods.description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation named content.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new OverviewTile.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes).

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • title : string (default: 'null')
    • icon : sap.ui.core.URI (default: 'null')
    • contact : string (default: 'null')
    • address : string (default: 'null')
    • opportunities : string (default: 'null')
    • rating : string (default: 'null')
    • lastContact : string (default: 'null')
    • nextContact : string (default: 'null')
    • revenue : string (default: 'null')
    • visible : boolean (default: true)
    • width : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • contactActive : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        • contactPress : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type sap.m.Tile can be used as well.

symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.22
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.22. PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

properties.name: removable
properties.description: Defines whether or not you can remove a picture

properties.description: Percentage of the space occupied by the image in the picture viewer control. Please note that if the factor is too close to 1, the navigation arrows usually displayed in desktop mode will not be available

symbols.name: sap.ca.ui.utils.busydialog
symbols.description:
Provides methods to show/remove the waiting/blocking screen in the Fiori style.

sap.ca.ui.utils.busydialog is a static class, the statement jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.utils.busydialog") needs to be called before the function can be used. Example: 

   jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.utils.busydialog");

   // request the BusyDialog to show the waiting/blocking screen
   sap.ca.ui.utils.busydialog.requireBusyDialog({
       text:"Loading..." //text is optional
   });

   // release the BusyDialog to remove the waiting/blocking screen
   sap.ca.ui.utils.busydialog.releaseBusyDialog();

Note

  • this BusyDialog will be shown with 1.5 seconds delay at the moment;
  • in a possible embedded function calls, you can require this BusyDialog more than once, but you need to take care to release the BusyDialog correspondingly in pair. (The text will be overwritten.)

methods.name: destroyBusyDialog
methods.description: Destroys the waiting/blocking screen (this method is only recommended if the App developer or the "Unified Shell" has a clean-up strategy and want to release the memory on purpose)

methods.name: releaseBusyDialog
methods.description: Removes the waiting/blocking screen, and is used in pair with the method "requireBusyDialog"

methods.name: requireBusyDialog

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description:
settings for the busy dialog:

text : {string} (optional) loading text

methods.description: Shows the waiting/blocking screen

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.dialog.confirmation
nodes.description:
Provides methods to show a confirmation dialog in the Fiori style.

sap.ca.ui.dialog.confirmation is a static class, the statement jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.dialog.factory") needs to be called before the function can be used. Example: 

   jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.dialog.factory");
   
   // provide your callback function, so that you can get informed if the enduser confirms or cancels the dialog
   var fnClose = function(oResult) {
       if (oResult) {
           console.log("isConfirmed:" + oResult.isConfirmed);
           if (oResult.sNote) {
               console.log(oResult.sNote);
           }
       }
   }
   
   //open the confirmation dialog
   sap.ca.ui.dialog.confirmation.open({
       question : "Send your decision on the shopping card submitted by Henry Emerald?",
       showNote : true,
       title : "Send",
       confirmButtonLabel : "Send"
   }, fnClose);

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.model.format.AmountFormat
nodes.description:
The AmountFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing file size values according to a set of format options.

If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.model.format.DateFormat
nodes.description:
The DateFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing date and time values according to a set of format options.

It uses sap.ui.core.format.DateFormat to format and parse dates, and adds a new style daysAgo for Date instances. With this style:

  • For today: "Today" will be displayed (localized)
  • For yesterday: "1 day ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • Between 2 days and 6 days in the past: "x days ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • In the future or more than 6 days in the past: the date will be formatted with a medium style
The daysAgo style can be formatted in UTC.

Supported format options are pattern based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.

nodes.name: sap.ca.ui.model.format.FileSizeFormat
nodes.description:
The FileSizeFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing file size values according to a set of format options.

Simplified logic: display in kB for 1e3 <= bytes < 1e6 display in MB for 1e6 <= bytes < 1e9 ...

The QuantityFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing file size values according to a set of format options.

If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.
